Package huffman

Class Huffman

  • java.lang.Object
    • huffman.Huffman
  • public class Huffman
extends java.lang.Object
    Huffman instances provide reusable Huffman Encoding Maps for compressing and decompressing text corpi with comparable distributions of characters.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      byte[] compress​(java.lang.String message)
      Compresses the given String message / text corpus into its Huffman coded bitstring, as represented by an array of bytes.
      java.lang.String decompress​(byte[] compressedMsg)
      Decompresses the given compressed array of bytes into their original, String representation.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • compress

        public byte[] compress​(java.lang.String message)
        Compresses the given String message / text corpus into its Huffman coded bitstring, as represented by an array of bytes. Uses the encodingMap field generated during construction for this purpose.
        Parameters:
        message - String representing the corpus to compress.
        Returns:
        byte[] representing the compressed corpus with the Huffman coded bytecode. Formatted as 3 components: (1) the first byte contains the number of characters in the message, (2) the bitstring containing the message itself, (3) possible 0-padding on the final byte.

      • decompress

        public java.lang.String decompress​(byte[] compressedMsg)
        Decompresses the given compressed array of bytes into their original, String representation. Uses the trieRoot field (the Huffman Trie) that generated the compressed message during decoding.
        Parameters:
        compressedMsg - byte[] representing the compressed corpus with the Huffman coded bytecode. Formatted as 3 components: (1) the first byte contains the number of characters in the message, (2) the bitstring containing the message itself, (3) possible 0-padding on the final byte.
        Returns:
        Decompressed String representation of the compressed bytecode message.
